summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330). The parties stipulate that a transcript of a sworn statement taken on November 21, 2005, in West Palm Beach, Florida, is a true and accurate copy and may be received as evidence at trial.

events.title: Sworn Statement Transcript
events.description: A sworn statement was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida. The transcript of this statement is the subject of the stipulation.

events.title: Stipulation Filed
events.description: The prosecution and defense stipulate that a 2005 transcript is authentic and can be entered as evidence at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.

keyFacts: The document is a court stipulation agreeing that a transcript of a sworn statement from November 21, 2005, is authentic evidence for Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.
The stipulation is signed by U.S. Attorney Damian Williams and by Maxwell's four defense attorneys: Christopher Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim.
The 2005 sworn statement was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida, indicating investigative activity related to the Epstein case years before Maxwell's 2020 indictment.
The stipulation is dated November 2021, placing it during the pre-trial or trial phase of Maxwell's criminal case (S2 20 CR 330).
